macro.para:
This macro expands to a containing each element of seq enclosed in parentheses. This is illustrated by the following pseudo-code:
((seq[0]))((seq[1])) ... ((seq[length(seq) - 1]))

This macro is used primarily by algorithms that operate specifically on . Normally, such algorithms "zip" the entire on which they operate and invoke the corresponding non-variadic algorithm. (The purpose of doing such a thing is to prevent an argument clash with the state or auxiliary data arguments of various algorithms.)
